author: James Hardy
title: Unveiling the Genius: Who Invented TikTok and the Story Behind Its Founder
text:
TikTok, transforming social media globally, epitomizes innovation, foresight, and technological mastery. This platform redefines digital interaction and sets new standards in content creation and consumption. Bridging technology with culture, TikTok connects millions worldwide, heralding a new era in digital connectivity and creativity.
Table of Contents
Who Invented TikTok?
Zhang Yiming, the architect of TikTok, is a figure synonymous with innovation in the digital age. Born in 1983 in Longyan, a city in China’s Fujian province, Yiming’s early life was steeped in a culture that valued education and intellectual curiosity. He graduated from Nankai University in 2005 with a degree in software engineering, a field that positioned him at the forefront of the growing tech industry in China.
Yiming’s career, marked by technical acumen and entrepreneurial insight, took a significant turn when he founded ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok, in 2012. Before this, his experience included roles at various tech companies, such as Kuxun, and a brief but pivotal stint at Microsoft. These experiences sharpened his understanding of the global technology landscape and the potential for user-focused applications.
Upon leaving Microsoft, Yiming’s entrepreneurial spirit led him to establish ByteDance. His vision for the company was innovative: to harness the power of
artificial intelligence to revolutionize the way internet users engage with content. This vision was deeply rooted in the belief that personalized content was key, a philosophy that would later become fundamental to TikTok’s success.
Yiming’s inspiration for TikTok, initially launched as Douyin, its Chinese version, stemmed from his keen observation of media consumption trends. He noticed a shift towards short, engaging content, particularly favored by younger users. This led to the creation of a platform that transcended the traditional
social media app, offering a space for creative expression and cultural exchange.
Under Yiming’s leadership, ByteDance rapidly advanced, with TikTok emerging as its most triumphant venture. Before TikTok, Yiming had guided the development of other applications like Toutiao, a news aggregator, gaining valuable insights into user behavior, crucial for TikTok’s development.
TikTok, created in September 2016, stood out with its user-friendly interface and an advanced algorithm that tailored content for each user, significantly enhancing user experience. These innovations were pivotal in distinguishing TikTok in the competitive social media sphere. TikTok’s features, especially the ‘For You’ page and a range of creative tools, resonated with TikTok users, driving the app’s popularity.
The app’s growth, however, was not without challenges. As TikTok’s popularity surged globally, it faced scrutiny from various quarters, including the Chinese government and the Chinese Communist Party. Issues like the handling of inappropriate content and adherence to community guidelines were hot topics. Discussions even arose about TikTok being banned in certain regions due to these concerns. Despite these hurdles, TikTok’s user base continued to expand, with users spending considerable
time engaging with TikTok videos, direct messages, and enjoying the app’s diverse features, including background music and push notifications.
The role of Zhang Yiming as ByteDance CEO was crucial in navigating these challenges. His leadership not only steered ByteDance and its employees through turbulent times but also ensured that TikTok remained a platform where users and other users could connect and share content freely, within the boundaries of established guidelines.
When Was TikTok Created?
TikTok was created in September 2016. This innovative social media platform distinguished itself through a user-friendly interface and an advanced algorithm that personalized content for each user. Such technical innovations made TikTok a standout in the social media landscape, offering an engaging and customized experience. The platform’s unique features, particularly the algorithm-driven ‘For You’ page and a suite of creative tools, set it apart in a competitive market.
The Origin of TikTok
The genesis of TikTok, known as Douyin in its homeland, China, represents a significant milestone in the evolution of social media. ByteDance, under the leadership of Zhang Yiming, launched Douyin in September 2016. The app’s inception was a direct response to the changing patterns of media consumption, particularly among the younger demographic, who were increasingly favoring mobile platforms for entertainment.
Douyin’s rise in China was meteoric. The app resonated with the youth, who found its format refreshing and liberating. Unlike traditional social media platforms that relied heavily on text and images, Douyin offered a new medium of expression: short, engaging video clips infused with music. This format was not just about sharing content; it was about storytelling in a vibrant, interactive way.
The success of Douyin can be largely attributed to its alignment with the cultural zeitgeist. China, at the time, was experiencing a surge in mobile internet usage, and Douyin tapped into this trend. The platform provided an outlet for creativity and self-expression, catering to the desires of a generation that valued individuality and connectedness.
Another factor in Douyin’s success was its emphasis on localization. The content on Douyin was highly tailored to the Chinese audience, with features and trends that resonated with local cultural nuances. This localization strategy was pivotal in distinguishing Douyin from other global social media platforms that were trying to penetrate the Chinese market.
The technology behind Douyin was equally revolutionary. ByteDance’s expertise in artificial intelligence played a crucial role in the app’s development. The algorithm used by Douyin was designed to learn user preferences over time, thereby enhancing the personalization of content. This level of customization was unprecedented in social media apps and set a new standard for user engagement.
Moreover, Douyin’s interface was designed with simplicity and user-friendliness in mind. The app’s design encouraged not just content consumption but also creation, with easy-to-use tools for editing and enhancing videos. This lowered the barrier to content creation, enabling users from various backgrounds to participate and express themselves.
The integration of music was another standout feature of Douyin. The app provided users with a vast library of songs and sound effects to use in their videos, making it a favorite among music enthusiasts and creators. This feature not only added a fun and engaging element to the videos but also played a significant role in music discovery and promotion.
Global Expansion and Renaming
The acquisition of
Musical.ly in 2017 was a strategic move by ByteDance to enter the global market. This expansion was followed by the rebranding of Douyin to TikTok for international users, merging the two platforms into a single global brand. This rebranding was crucial in unifying the user experience and establishing TikTok’s global presence.
ByteDance
ByteDance, established in 2012 by Zhang Yiming, has emerged as a dominant force in the global tech industry, particularly in the realm of social media and AI-driven content platforms. The company, headquartered in Beijing, China, has rapidly expanded its footprint, challenging traditional paradigms in technology and content consumption.
Early Years and Foundational Philosophy
ByteDance started as a relatively small enterprise, but its foundational philosophy was ambitious: to combine the power of artificial intelligence with the burgeoning field of mobile internet to revolutionize content consumption. The company’s initial focus was on news aggregation, which led to the creation of Toutiao, a news platform that personalized content based on user preferences through AI algorithms. This focus on personalized content became a defining feature of ByteDance’s approach to all its subsequent platforms, including TikTok.
Expansion and Diversification
ByteDance’s journey is marked by continuous expansion and diversification. Beyond Toutiao and TikTok, the company developed a suite of products across varied domains, including work collaboration tools, gaming, and education technology. Each of these ventures reflected ByteDance’s core competency in AI and content personalization, demonstrating its ability to innovate across different sectors.
Global Growth and Challenges
ByteDance’s global growth strategy has been both aggressive and strategic. The company’s expansion outside of China began in earnest with the launch of TikTok and its acquisition of Musical.ly, a move that significantly bolstered its international presence. However, this expansion was not without challenges. ByteDance had to navigate various regulatory landscapes, cultural differences, and political tensions, particularly between China and the United States.
Investment in Research and Development
A significant aspect of ByteDance’s success is its heavy investment in research and development. The company has established several AI research centers around the world, focusing on areas such as machine learning, natural language processing, and
computer vision. This investment not only fuels the company’s product innovations but also contributes to the broader tech community through research papers and collaborations.
Corporate Culture and Management
ByteDance is known for its dynamic and innovative corporate culture. The company fosters a work environment that encourages creativity, experimentation, and a flat management structure. This culture has been instrumental in attracting top talent from around the globe, which in turn drives the company’s continuous innovation.
Financial Growth and Valuation
Financially, ByteDance has seen remarkable growth, becoming one of the most valuable startups in the world. The company has secured substantial funding from major global investors, and its valuation has skyrocketed, reflecting the market’s confidence in its business model and future potential.
Future Prospects
Looking ahead, ByteDance is poised to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital content and AI technology. With its diverse portfolio of products and ongoing investment in cutting-edge research, the company is well-positioned to continue its trajectory of growth and innovation.
Challenges and Controversies
TikTok faced numerous legal and privacy issues in various countries, challenging its global expansion. These ranged from data privacy concerns to accusations of censorship. ByteDance navigated these complexities by adapting to different market regulations, emphasizing transparency, and continuously updating privacy policies.
Impact on Culture and Social Media
TikTok has significantly influenced social media and content trends, creating a new paradigm in user interaction and content creation. Its impact extends to the music industry, where it has become a platform for viral hits, and the entertainment and advertising sectors, where it has introduced innovative marketing strategies. TikTok’s success demonstrates how technology can reshape cultural trends and redefine entertainment consumption in the digital age.
Revolutionizing Digital Expression: The TikTok Phenomenon
TikTok, born from Zhang Yiming’s vision and ByteDance’s innovative prowess, has revolutionized the social media landscape. From its origins as Douyin to its global dominance, TikTok exemplifies the fusion of technology, creativity, and cultural adaptability. Despite facing legal and privacy hurdles, its impact on media consumption, cultural trends, and industries like music and advertising is undeniable. TikTok’s story is not just about a successful app, but a testament to the transformative power of technology in shaping modern digital culture.

author: EFE
title: Con un triplete de Kylian Mbappé, PSG goleó por 9-0 en la Copa de Francia - ESPN
text: [Paris Saint-Germain](/futbol/equipo/_/id/160/paris-saint-germain) no tuvo piedad del humilde [US Revel](/futbol/equipo/_/id/22140/revel) por la [Copa de Francia](/futbol/liga/_/nombre/fra.coupe_de_france) y lo goleó por 9-0 con un triplete de [Kylian Mbappé](/futbol/jugador/_/id/231388/kylian-mbappe) para avanzar a los 16avos de la competición. Mbappé no levantó el pie del acelerador e inició 2024 con tres tantos con los que alcanzó los 25 esta temporada. Además, anotó el decimoctavo hat-trick de su carrera. En este encuentro tuvo dos grandes socios en Marcos Asensio y Carlos Soler. Para recordar será la asistencia de taco en el aire de Soler para que el francés estampe su doblete parcial. Con un 0-4 en contra, el Revel no tenía nada que hacer. El milagro era imposible y su único objetivo fue evitar una goleada escandalosa. Sin embargo, no lo consiguió: el 0-5, lo celebró Mbappé para cerrar su triplete; el 0-6 fue para Gonçalo Ramos, que no falló desde el punto de penal; y al final, Randal Kolo Muani, con un doblete, y Cher Ndour, con asistencia de Mbappé, se unieron a la fiesta. El resultado final fue un 9-0 categórico. También hay que destacar que [el arquero del PSG fue Keylor Navas, quien volvió a jugar en el equipo tras casi un año](/futbol/costa-rica/nota/_/id/13070105/keylor-navas-esperar-349-dias-volver-titularidad-psg).

author: Шосталь Александр
title: Смартфон может загореться в кармане: как избежать опасности и какие признаки предупреждают - все последние новости на сегодня - 112.ua
text:
Смартфон может загореться в кармане: как избежать опасности и какие признаки предупреждают.
Журналист
Шосталь Александр
Риск возгорания смартфона увеличивается из-за перегрева, механических повреждений или неисправной батареи. В жару и во время интенсивной работы устройства опасность выше, особенно когда телефон находится в тесной одежде и тепло не отводится.
Об этом сообщает .
При каких обстоятельствах смартфон может загореться в кармане
Перегрев чаще всего происходит во время запуска 'тяжелых' приложений, навигации или съемки на камеру. При высокой температуре окружающей среды или при недостаточном охлаждении корпус нагревается быстрее, что увеличивает вероятность возгорания.
Отдельный риск — механические воздействия. Сильный удар или длительное давление (например, когда носят в заднем кармане) могут деформировать батарею и спровоцировать короткое замыкание, вплоть до пожара.
Также к дополнительным факторам риска относят:
- вздутие батареи — признак внутреннего повреждения, что может привести к перегреву;
- изношенная батарея — со временем теряет стабильность, а химические процессы становятся менее предсказуемыми;
- неожиданные перегревы — нагрев без нагрузки или резкие отключения являются поводом проверить состояние батареи;
- неоригинальные компоненты — дешевые зарядные устройства и элементы питания могут не соответствовать требованиям безопасности.
Если вы заметили вздутие батареи или сильный нагрев без очевидных причин, стоит как можно быстрее провести диагностику смартфона — это поможет предотвратить серьезные последствия.
Напоминаем, рекордная жара представляет угрозу не только для людей, но и для смартфонов, которые могут быстро перегреваться и отключаться. Чтобы избежать повреждений батареи и внутренних компонентов, стоит заранее обеспечить гаджету условия для охлаждения.
Также мы писали, что троттлинг — это встроенный механизм, который автоматически снижает скорость процессора во время перегрева. Благодаря этому смартфон сохраняет работоспособность даже при интенсивной нагрузке.
Представленный в новости материал напоминает о рисках перегрева смартфонов из-за различных обстоятельств, таких как механические повреждения, перегрев и батарея. Важно своевременно выявлять признаки проблем и избегать ситуаций, которые могут угрожать целостности устройства.Читайте также

author: Femi Ogbonnikan
title: Ogun as topmost economy
text:
FOR the umpteenth time, Ogun State once again emerged as one of the three leading economically viable states in Nigeria. For three consecutive sessions under the administration of Governor Dapo Abiodun, the state has routinely maintained its competitive edge over the rest parts of the country. This time around, as a testament to its growing economic potential, the latest report conducted by Economic Confidential, measuring the Internally Revenue Generating (IGR) capacity of each state as a percentage of Federal allocation, put Ogun State on the front roll. While states like Bayelsa, Katsina, Jigawa, Niger, Adamawa, Yobe, and Taraba remained on the fringes and largely insolvent, Lagos, Ogun, and Rives states maintained their leading position among those that could conveniently survive without any federal allocation. Putting the state on the pedestal of sustainable growth within a term of four years is no mean feat. As a comparative analysis of the annual State Viability Index indicates, those categorised as insolvent generally have an IGR of less than 10 percent of their total receipts of federal allocation. Based on this standard, only six states have the economic potential to stay afloat under zero allocation from the Federal Government. And Ogun State stands tall among its peer group, closely trailing Lagos.
According to the report, Ogun State is next to Lagos as Nigeria’s top investment destination. By comparative analysis, the Abiodun-led administration outshone Rivers State on the list of economically viable states for the year 2022 alongside Kaduna, Kwara, Oyo, and Edo states. The breakdown of the figures compiled from the release by the Nigerian Bureau of Statistics (NBS) and the Federal Account Allocation Committee (FAAC) showed that Lagos received the sum of N370, 921, 413, 425.62 from the Federation Account and generated N651,145, 633.085 as internally generated revenue, while Ogun received N113,404, 027,439.22 from the Federation Account and generated N120,548, 157,140.78 internally. On the other hand, Rivers State received N363.4bn from the Federation Account and generated N172bn; Kaduna received N155bn and generated N58bn; Kwara received N99bn and generated N35.7bn; Oyo received N181bn and generated N62bn, while Edo received N147bn in federal allocation and generated N47.4bn.
This revelation was made during the presentation of the 2022 Annual States Viability Index Report in Abuja recently. In summary, the figures showed that the total Internally Generated Revenue of N1.5trn from the seven most viable states in 2022 was almost twice the total IGR of 29 states put together merely generating about N650bn. On the flipside, six states, including Bayelsa, Akwa Ibom, and Katsina states, failed to generate up to 10 percent of the total allocations received from the Federal Government for 2022 and were therefore declared insolvent. Interestingly, oil-rich Bayelsa state is at the bottom of the list with N273bn federal allocation and N15.9bn IGR, representing 5.81% of the allocations. On the other hand, Kebbi State received N119bn FAAC allocation and generated N9bn IGR, representing 7.67 percent, while Katsina which got N165bn FAAC allocation, recorded N13bn IGR, representing 7.90 percent. Similarly, Akwa Ibom which received N360bn, generated N34.8bn, representing 9.66 percent, while its Taraba state counterpart earned N103 billion FAAC and generated N10.2 billion, translating to 9.91 percent. Yobe received N105bn and generated N10.4bn, accounting for 9.91 percent.
There is a wide range of implications for these poorly performing states. One, they will only depend on federal allocation to survive because of their comparatively low capacity for internally generated revenue (IGR). Secondly, they will have comparatively less revenue left to implement the capital expenditure components of their budgets, thus facing a greater risk of resorting to more borrowing or under-implementing their capital budgets. Worse than that, they offer no attraction for investment that could lead to economic growth. Ogun State is a nautical mile away from this scenario. Ranked higher on the performance index, it has comparatively limited dependence on federally distributed revenue for its operations and thus has greater viability if it were to theoretically exist as an independent entity.
This achievement is a testament to the positive result of the I-S-E-Y-A mantra of the administration. As an initiative invented to stimulate collective action for greater efficiency and productivity, the administration has never looked back on its drive for sustainable economic growth and prosperity for all since Abiodun assumed the mantle of leadership in 2019. Whatever the state has been able to achieve in terms of infrastructure development, healthcare delivery, education and human capital development, transportation, housing, youth empowerment, and agriculture, among others, is a result of collective ownership of the process, which is encapsulated in the acronym I-S-E-Y-A. It, therefore, goes without saying that the initiative has contributed significantly to poverty reduction and widespread prosperity throughout Ogun State.
Right from the inception of his administration, Governor Abiodun has routinely maintained his mission statement, focusing on “qualitative governance and to create the enabling environment for a public-private sector partnership, which is fundamental to the creation of an enduring economic development and individual prosperity of the people”. So, by sustaining the trajectory of growth, certainly, the best is yet to come for the state. It can only get better with continued commitment, focused leadership, and support of the citizenry.
Over the years, relevant stakeholders have always expressed concern over states’ heavy dependence on federal revenue for the implementation of yearly budgets. This is borne out of the need for enhanced public revenue generation to implement capital expenditure components of their budgets after fulfilling obligations to workers and other operating expenses. However, due to a lack of creative ideas, fiscal transparency, and accountability in public finance, most states have remained indifferent to the call.
Contrarily, Governor Abiodun has included an aggressive revenue drive as part of the cardinal agenda of his administration since its inception. And that is what has accounted for the less dependence of the state on revenue allocation from the Federal Government.
It is also the reason for the success the administration has recorded in the area of infrastructure development which makes the state a leading investment destination not only in Nigeria but West African sub-region.
With an assurance of an enabling environment, Governor Abiodun has continued to extend his calls on foreign businesses to make the state, especially the Special Economic Processing Zone, the destination of choice while considering investing in Nigeria.
While speaking as a guest on CNBC Africa recently on the sidelines of the Intra-African Trade Fair, put together by Afreximbank, in Cairo, Egypt, he said Ogun State had put everything in place to host any business venture.
He said Ogun State had the required infrastructure, including accessibility, access to power, and a youthful and educated population to make it investor-friendly.
His words: “We like to refer to ourselves as the Gateway State. We are the gateway to Nigeria’s prosperity. We are the industrial capital of Nigeria. By all accounts, we have well over 5,000 industries. We are the number one in non-oil revenue in Nigeria because we have large mineral deposits, particularly limestone.
“That explains why we have Lafarge, Dangote, and many other cement factories. The biggest cement factory in Nigeria is in Ogun State.
“Now, why are we here (Cairo)? We are here to attract more investors to our state, particularly as we pride ourselves on having the required infrastructure, be it road, rail, or air. We have a new airport, unarguably one of the best airports in Nigeria.
“Our Airport is situated in our Special Economic Processing Zone. The zone is being supported by Afreximbank and being operated and constructed by a private sector player called Arise LLP.
“Today, we want people to know about the zone, to come and establish processing concerns and factories in that zone, referencing the 5,000 other industrial activities that exist in Ogun State.”
The governor listed some of the companies in the state including Lafarge, Nestle, Cadbury, May&Baker, Unilever, and Olam flours, among others. He noted that companies coming to invest in the state would take advantage of its vast agro-produce like rubber, cassava, which Ogun is the number one producer in the world, palm oil, cashew, cocoa, cotton, eggs, and poultry.
“We are trying to attract investors to this processing zone, more so because we have gas, which allows them to access power. So, you are sure that your major cost of production, which could be power in most instances, is already mitigated.
“And I believe that we’ve managed to convince a lot of our listeners that Ogun State, the industrial capital of Nigeria, the education capital of Nigeria with reserve of youthful population is ready to receive you and as a government, we’ve provided a lot of reforms and policy initiatives to further increase our rating on the ease of doing business index,” he added.
The Governor also spoke on the significance of the African Quality Assurance Centre (AQAC), which has been established at the Special Economic Processing Zone, a development which he said, would make Nigeria get value for her agro-produce.
But with AQAC in Ogun State, and within the agro-processing zone, Prince Abiodun said agro-produce from Nigeria can now be certified fit-for-purpose in line with world best practices. “And now, what they
do in AQAC is, they don’t wait until you have grown or you have harvested. They intervene from the point of your inputs, from the point of how you have planted, from what type of fertilisers you have used, from what type of fertilisers you were meant to use to ensure that by the time they are stamping your agro-produce, it is certified fit-for-purpose.
“Hitherto, when goods will have to go to Ghana or any other country to be exported, it means that agro-produce would probably have been undervalued. So, from now on, Nigeria can now export its agro-produce at the right value because it’s stamped fit-for-purpose from Nigeria,” he enthused.
By the time all of these propositions come to fruition, Ogun State will be the envy of all. And they will because the foundation for the necessary infrastructure that would serve as a pull factor has already been put in place.
This is part of the reason Prince Abiodun emerged as Vanguard’s Governor of the Year 2021 Award for creating enduring economic development and individual prosperity in Ogun State. As attested to by the organisers of the event, he emerged winner of the award through a rigorous selection process. Since then, he’s been doing his best not to let the guard down.
- Ogbonnikan writes in from Abeokuta, Ogun State.

author: @14News
title: Video shows woman shooing moose from grocery cart
text: Video shows woman shooing moose from grocery cart ANCHORAGE, Alaska ( [KTUU](https://www.alaskasnewssource.com/2024/02/15/video-shows-anchorage-woman-shooing-moose-grocery-cart/)/Gray News) - Interactions with moose are not an uncommon scene around Alaska, but when they find an interest in groceries, Alaskans just can’t help but whip out their phones. That was the scene on Feb. 10 when an Anchorage woman on a grocery run found herself in a Costco parking lot, caught between her cart full of food and a hungry bull moose. Amber Rotar was the woman trying to shoo the moose away and decided once it became clear he wasn’t budging, she’d whip her phone camera out — with the cart and her car between them, of course. “Thankfully, I didn’t have my kids, so it’s like, I don’t have to worry about not having my children trampled,” Rotar said. “But no, I just tried not to aggravate him.” Rotar posted the video to her [business social media pages](https://www.facebook.com/feedmeak/posts/888920153243184) for Feed Me AK, a meal prep delivery service that she owns and operates. The mother of two was also captured by another bystander across the lot, whose photo made its way onto the usual Facebook group pages, garnering dozens of comments and likes with the caption “Only in Alaska” attached to it. In the photo taken by the other woman, Rotar can be seen holding up a stern finger, pointing at the moose as if giving it a warning. “He came over and stuck his face in my sweet potatoes and was also quite curious about my ... flannel sheets, and then bell peppers,” Rotar said. Rotar tells the moose to “Scooch!” as it peruses her basket of goodies, but once the moose put its ears back — a key sign of agitation in a moose — Rotar takes a step back. “We only got about 9-10 seconds because when his behavior — his ears changed, I decided it was probably more important to focus on him and not on my phone.” Copyright 2024 KTUU via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

text:

Subito dopo il tramonto la cometa resterÃ visibile per meno di un'ora a Ovest. L'evento sarÃ trasmesso in diretta streaming dal Virtual Telescope Project a partire dalle 19:00. author: Erik Pedersen
title: Golden Globes Winners List – Updating Live
text:
Michael Buckner/Getty Refresh for latest: The 2024 awards season is officially underway with the 81st annual Golden Globes being handed out tonight, and Deadline is posting the winners live as they are announced. Check out the list so far below.
Jo Koy is hosting the ceremony at the Beverly Hilton, and the full list of presenters is here . This year’s event includes two new categories — Cinematic and Box Office Achievement and Best Stand-Up Comedian on Television — but the annual honorary Cecil B. DeMille and Carol Burnett career awards are taking 2024 off.
Related Stories News Golden Globe Nominations: ‘Barbie’, ‘Oppenheimer’ Top Movie List; ‘Succession’ Leads Way In TV

author: Ryan TalbotSyracuse.com
title: Buffalo Bills player saves stranded motorist in lake effect storm | Community Notes | nny360.com
text:
Buffalo is known as the city of good neighbors for a reason.
Buffalo is currently dealing with lake effect snow and strong winds that are producing a blizzard like conditions. The weather has led to a travel ban in the area and has pushed the Buffalo Bills’ Super Wild Card Weekend matchup against the Pittsburgh Steelers to Monday afternoon at 4:30 p.m.
Despite there being a travel ban in place, one motorist in Orchard Park was out on the road on Sunday. The driver could have been an essential worker trying to get to their place of work, but they suddenly became stranded. Luckily for the resident, two Bills players saw the vehicle and were able to get them back on the road.
Offensive tackle Ryan Van Demark shared a video on his Instagram story showing Alec Anderson helping the vehicle out.
“Good samaritan, Alec. Helping the people,” Van Demark says during the video.
You can also hear Anderson telling the driver that he’s good to go.
The motorist was lucky to have Anderson and Van Demark in the area as the storm was expected to be at its worst early on Sunday afternoon.
“The bull’s-eye of the storm is predicted to hit midday Sunday afternoon,” Gov. Kathy Hochul stated on Saturday.
In addition to the most intense lake effect snow bands and wind, the wind chill could fall to five degrees on Sunday afternoon.
As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases. Johnson Newspapers 7.1

author: hanna-seariac
title: What is best state for upward mobility?
text:
In a press conference held earlier this month, Gov. Spencer Cox once again praised Utah for its high rate of social capital and upward mobility.
“We lead the nation again. A new report just came out yesterday or the day before that I saw around social capital and upward mobility,” Cox said. “Utah was No. 1 again.”
The report showed that, in Utah, “if you’re born in poverty, you don’t have to stay in poverty,” he said, adding that this is important to him.
A recent report from the Archbridge Institute found that Utah had the best environment for social mobility. The report graded all 50 states on several different areas, like community activities and neighbors, education quality and freedom, judicial system quality, regulation and business dynamism.
The report defines social mobility as not only “a person’s ability to climb the income ladder and outearn the previous generation,” but it additionally states that “social mobility is also concerned with achievement, aspirations, purpose and skills development.”
An environment supportive of social mobility means community members have favorable conditions to be upwardly mobile. In addition to Utah scoring No. 1 for social mobility, states in the Mountain West had some of the highest average scores overall.
One aspect that contributed to Utah’s high ranking mentioned by the report authors was the state’s “one-stop-shop for welfare services.”
“Utah ranks first overall in the 2023 Social Mobility Index, the best in the nation,” the report stated. “Utah performs well in several key areas including business dynamism (second), parent engagement and stability (third), and charity (sixth). However, Utah could further support social mobility by addressing its lower scores for education quality and freedom (29th) and predatory state action (27th), both of which rank in the bottom half of the nation.”
Education quality and freedom was measured in the study by National Assessment of Education Programs test scores from fourth and eighth grade, school choice, university quality and community college graduation rates. Predatory state actions were determined by looking at the amount of fines and fees local governments collect, corruption perceptions and civil asset forfeiture.
For years, Utah has been recognized as a place that’s upwardly mobile.
Related The ‘Utah family miracle’ and why it matters A 2014 article in The Atlantic pointed toward two strengths that Salt Lake City has that make it a positive environment for upward mobility: “A strong middle class and a less extreme gap between the rich and the poor.”
“Low-income kids who grew up in the region, the researchers found, had some of the greatest chances of moving up the income ladder as they aged,” The Atlantic reported.
Based on data from 2020 to 2022, the Gini Index from the U.S. Census Bureau ranks Utah as having one of the lowest economic inequality scores across the country. The Gini Index measures concentration of wealth — the lower the score, the more equally wealth is found across the population.
Utah is ranked as a financially healthy state across other metrics, too. In 2018, the Mercatus Center at George Mason University ranked Utah eighth in the country for fiscal health. Utah has the highest social capital rate, according to a report from the Joint Economic Committee, also ranking No. 1 for family unity, social support and philanthropic health.
The Beehive State also has a robust middle class.
“The good news is, Utah has a remarkably strong middle class. By the latest numbers, Utah’s middle-class households stand at 54% of the total. That’s well ahead of the national average of 47%. It’s also ahead of every other state. And the second- and third-place states are our neighbors, Wyoming and Idaho, at 52%,” Peter Reichard wrote .
